description: Welcome to a 50.8 Acre campus, where celebrating inspiration is a way of life! CBIT is truly the abode of learning and bonding. The fun campus life fills the hearts of students with optimism. Providing the student a judicious amalgam of education and enjoyment, the CBIT campus offers a host of useful amenities. Thus the student doesn’t need to step out of the university premises for anything. It goes that extra bit to make hostel life, which most students are initially apprehensive of, comfortable and pleasant, thereby making it a second home.

chaitanya_sudhee.description: Chaitanya Sudhee is a platform that nurtures students' skills, entrepreneurial spirit, and technical expertise through various clubs and cells.

clubs_and_cells.name: Entrepreneurship Development Cell
clubs_and_cells.description: Entrepreneurship Development Cell (EDC), CBIT, is a student-coordinated club supervised by experienced faculty members. The motto of the club is Entrepreneur 'rising' ideas. The club has a vision to pave a path towards ‘Entrepreneurial India’. The institute aims to groom and support all students with entrepreneurial interests and start-up ideas.

chaitanya_saahithi.description: Chaitanya Saahithi is a platform that promotes literary, communication, and leadership skills among students through various clubs and activities.

chaitanya_samskruthi.description: Chaitanya Samskruthi is a cultural platform that encourages students to explore their artistic talents through singing, dancing, instrumental music, and creative writing.

chaitanya_kreeda.description: Chaitanya Kreeda is the sports and games club of CBIT, dedicated to organizing competitions at various levels and encouraging students to participate in university, state, national, and international events. The club actively contributes to the 'Fit India' movement and conducts 'Yoga Day' every year. It also provides facilities for both indoor and outdoor sports.
chaitanya_kreeda.achievements: Over the last 42 years, CBIT students have consistently figured among achievers at various levels in sports and games.
chaitanya_kreeda.facilities: A dedicated block for indoor sports and games activities, along with outdoor facilities to meet the needs of all students.

Physical Education.description: The Department of Physical Education at CBIT focuses on the holistic development of students through physical fitness and sports. The department maintains state-of-the-art infrastructure to support a wide range of sports and physical activities.

chaitanya_seva.description: Chaitanya Seva is dedicated to promoting social responsibility and community service among students through various initiatives and clubs.

clubs.name: NSS
clubs.description: Established in 2007, NSS CBIT consists of UG and PG students actively participating in social service activities within the institute and the society.

clubs.name: Street Cause
clubs.description: An NGO established in 2009, committed to social welfare and community development, making CBIT one of the best and longest-running divisions.

clubs.name: Engineers Without Borders (EWB)
clubs.description: Founded in 2015 by Dr. Shaukat Mirza, EWB-CBIT undertakes real-life sustainable social projects to create global leaders.

clubs.name: NCC
clubs.description: The National Cadet Corps at CBIT trains students in leadership, discipline, and service to the nation.

clubs.name: Parivrita
clubs.description: A social initiative club that engages students in community service and various social causes.

chaitanya_chaaya.description: Chaitanya Chaaya is a creative platform that nurtures visual storytelling and artistic expression through film making and photography.

clubs.name: Film Making Club
clubs.description: A club dedicated to exploring and mastering the art of filmmaking through workshops, projects, and screenings.

clubs.name: Photography Club
clubs.description: A community of photography enthusiasts who capture moments and creatively express ideas through images.

chaitanya_smriti.description: Chaitanya Smriti is the Alumni Club of CBIT, fostering connections between alumni and the institution to build a strong and supportive community.

clubs.name: Alumni Club
clubs.description: A platform for alumni to stay connected, share experiences, and contribute to the growth of the institution.

students_clubs.description: Students are encouraged to join professional bodies and clubs to develop skills, nurture creativity, and build strong interpersonal communication and teamwork.

clubs: IEEE Circuits & Systems Society - Student Branch

professional_bodies: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)

committees.name: Anti-Ragging Committee
committees.description: This Committee looks into registered cases of ragging at the Institute level and awards punishment to defaulters after a thorough enquiry as per the Guidelines of UGC and AICTE. Depending on the seriousness of the case, the Committee decides on the need for further help from Police or Legal forces.

committees.name: Anti-Ragging Squad
committees.description: The members of this Squad must be alert and active at all times, meeting the requirements of any emergency situations, when informed by the Anti-ragging Cell or noticed by themselves. They make surprise visits to the campus, hostels, and surroundings vulnerable to ragging, and are empowered to curb the menace on the spot, reporting to the Principal and the Directorate of Student Affairs.

committees.name: Anti-Ragging Duties
committees.description: The Heads of Departments are directed to take a leading role in preventing ragging at the CBIT campus and surrounding areas, including Gandipet, Mehdipatnam, Langarhouse, Khanapur Bus Stands, Boys Hostel, and Girls Hostel. Anti-ragging duties are to be performed from 4:10 PM to 6:00 PM daily from the first day of class work for first-year students.

committees.name: Anti-Ragging Cell (Help Desk)
committees.description: This Cell can be contacted or informed through messages 24/7 to register or report cases of ragging.

contacts.name: Prof. B. Sreenivasa Reddy
contacts.designation: Head, Physics and I Year Co-ordinating Head

contacts.name: Prof. M. Ganeshwar Rao
contacts.designation: Mathematics and Chief Warden, CBIT Hostels

committees.name: Disciplinary Committee
committees.description: A Disciplinary Committee is constituted to look into the general conduct of students in the campus and their compliance with the Code of Conduct. It monitors discipline within the campus, hostels, and even outside if necessary. The committee reports violation cases to the Principal and takes necessary action based on the severity of the situation.
